I ran the given trainBR.py and got a accuracy of 84 percent.

After this I tried various techniques to find the correlation between labels and thus to group them
one thing that i tried was to combine the features along with labels as input and output as individual labels,
and train a linear regression classifier on it.
then i got the importance of each feature using the weight given to each feature in the regressor.

This did not yield me a good output, I did not have time to figure out why.
I am not bundling the code for the above method since it did not work out.


Another technique that I used was by using empirical covariance of labels.
I got the covariance between the labels and then grouped the labels which had high correlations.
I consider this a group and use this as input to my group classifier.

The Group classifier creates n classifier where n is the number of groups.

While predicting the predictions is ran on all the classifiers and the union of all those is returned


output:
